snippet: Gov. Rick Perry of Texas called the indictment charging him with trying to pressure a Democratic prosecutor to step down a “political” prosecution and pledged to stay in office until the end of his term in January.
abstract: Texas Gov Rick Perry, vowing to fight indictment on charges of abuse of power, calls two felony counts a farce and a political prosecution; vows to stay in office until the end of his term in January.

byline.original: By MANNY FERNANDEZ and JONATHAN MARTIN
byline.contributor: Manny Fernandez reported from Austin, Tex., and Jonathan Martin from Washington. Emma G. Fitzsimmons contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Gov. Rick Perry of Texas called the indictment charging him with trying to pressure a Democratic prosecutor to step down a “political” prosecution and pledged to stay in office until the end of his term in January.

headline.main: Amid Debate Over Who Overstepped, Perry Calls Indictment a ‘Farce’
headline.print_headline: Amid Debate Over Who Overstepped, Perry Calls Indictment a ‘Farce’
